title: README remote setup documentation
description: Add Remote Gateway Setup section to README.md with instructions for SSH tunneling, Tailscale, LAN connections, device pairing, and Keychain token storage.
close_reason: Closed

title: GitService commit parsing tests
description: Unit tests for GitService. Use AgentBoard's own repo dir or temp git repo. Tests: (1) fetchCurrentBranch returns non-empty string, (2) fetchCommits returns sorted commits with non-nil SHAs, (3) bead ID extraction from commit subjects e.g. 'AB-123: fix' -> ['AB-123'], (4) multiple/duplicate bead IDs deduplicated, (5) branch parsing 'HEAD -> main, origin/main' -> 'main', (6) empty refs -> nil branch. GitService is an actor; use async tests. File: AgentBoardTests/GitServiceTests.swift.
close_reason: Closed

title: Device pairing flow UI
description: Add user-friendly pairing guide when connectionError is .pairingRequired. Show step-by-step instructions, device ID, copyable approval command, and a retry button.
close_reason: Closed

title: Emoji support in chat.
description: Ability to select and send emoji in chat window
close_reason: Implemented: Added emoji picker button to chat input. Clicking shows popover with 30 common emojis arranged in a grid. Selecting an emoji inserts it into the message text field.

title: AppState layout toggle tests
description: Unit tests for isFocusMode, toggleSidebar, toggleBoard, toggleFocusMode, persistLayoutState. File: AgentBoardTests/AppStateLayoutTests.swift. Tests: (1) isFocusMode true only when both hidden, (2) toggleSidebar flips and persists AB_sidebarCollapsed, (3) toggleBoard flips and persists AB_boardCollapsed, (4) toggleFocusMode normal→both false, (5) toggleFocusMode focus→both true, (6) persistLayoutState writes inverted values, (7) sidebarVisible initializes from UserDefaults. Use @MainActor struct + Swift Testing framework.
close_reason: Closed

title: Thinking level control in chat doesn't take effect
description: The thinking level picker in ChatPanelView calls sessions.patch with thinkingLevel, and chatThinkingLevel updates in the UI, but the LLM response doesn't actually change thinking depth. The OpenClaw Control UI and Telegram can change thinking levels successfully. Investigate: (1) Is sessions.patch actually being received by gateway? (2) Does the gateway apply per-session thinking overrides to the agent runtime? (3) Compare with how the Control UI webchat does it (uses the same sessions.patch RPC). The RPC call itself looks correct (key + thinkingLevel params match gateway source).

title: State change: status → identified
description:
Set status to identified

Reason: Root cause: get-reply-run.ts doesn't check sessionEntry.thinkingLevel when resolving thinking level

title: State change: status → closed
description:
Changed status from identified to closed

Reason: Fixed in get-reply-run.ts: Added check for sessionEntry.thinkingLevel before falling back to model default. The bug was that sessions.patch correctly saved the thinking level to the session store, but when processing chat messages via chat.send, the code only checked for inline /think directive in the message body and fell back to the model's default thinking level without checking the session entry. Now the logic is: 1) Check for inline /think directive in message body, 2) Check sessionEntry.thinkingLevel, 3) Fall back to model default. All 688 auto-reply tests pass.

title: Event drop detection logging
description:
Add logging to detect when chat events are dropped or lost.

Implementation:
1. Add OSLog logger to GatewayClient (like OpenClaw uses)
2. Log key events:
   - When new event stream is created (and old one replaced)
   - When events are received but no subscriber exists
   - Sequence number gaps (if gateway provides seq numbers)
   - WebSocket disconnect/reconnect events

3. Add to AppState:
   - Log when handleGatewayEventOnMain filters out event (wrong session key)
   - Log when delta received but no matching assistant message exists
   - Track event processing latency

4. Optional: Add debug UI to show:
   - Last received event timestamp
   - Connection state history
   - Event counts (received vs processed)

This helps diagnose future chat issues quickly.

Depends on: AB-2vp
notes:
Added OSLog logging to GatewayClient for:
- connect(): logs connecting vs reconnecting with state
- disconnect(): logs user-initiated disconnect
- handleDisconnect(): logs WebSocket disconnect with wasConnected state
- handleEvent(): sequence gap detection logging for missed events
- broadcastEvent(): warns when event received with no subscribers

Build succeeded, unit tests pass (74/76, 2 pre-existing symlink failures).

title: App icon missing from Assets.xcassets
description: AppIcon.appiconset only contains Contents.json — no actual image files. App will show blank icon on macOS.

title: Add accessibility identifiers to interactive elements
description: Only TaskCardView has .accessibilityIdentifier (2 occurrences). All interactive elements across views need identifiers for UI testing and VoiceOver support.

title: Epic: Fix AgentBoard Chat Event Stream Flakiness
description:
Root cause: GatewayClient.events creates a new AsyncStream every time it's accessed, replacing the previous stream. This causes race conditions where messages get lost when multiple parts of the app try to listen to events.

Current behavior:
- GatewayClient.events (line 217-240) creates NEW stream each call
- Old stream's continuation is replaced, dropping pending events
- Multiple consumers compete for single event source

Reference: See analysis in AgentBoard/Services/GatewayClient.swift events property. Compare to OpenClaw's GatewayConnection which uses multi-subscriber broadcast pattern (subscribers dictionary).

Subtasks:
1. AB-2vp.1 - Multi-subscriber event broadcast pattern
2. AB-2vp.2 - Graceful reconnection with event resume
3. AB-2vp.3 - Event drop detection logging
close_reason: All subtasks implemented: (1) Multi-subscriber event broadcast pattern in events property, (2) Graceful reconnection with isReconnecting flag preserving subscribers, (3) Event drop detection logging with OSLog and sequence gap detection.

title: AppConfigStore discovery logic tests
description: Unit tests for AppConfigStore (safe methods only — do NOT call loadOrCreate/save which write to real ~/.agentboard). Tests via temp dirs: (1) discoverProjects(in:) with .beads subdir returns project, (2) without .beads returns empty, (3) non-existent dir returns empty, (4) sorts alphabetically by folder name, (5) discoverOpenClawConfig with temp openclaw.json parses URL and token, (6) missing openclaw.json returns nil. File: AgentBoardTests/AppConfigStoreTests.swift. Use Swift Testing.
close_reason: Closed

title: Enter to send, Shift+Enter for newline in chat
description: Chat input should send message on Enter key. Shift+Enter should insert a newline for multi-line messages. Standard chat UX pattern (matches Telegram, Slack, Discord behavior).
close_reason: Enter to send, Shift+Enter for newline implemented

title: Keychain token storage
description: Replace plain-text token in ~/.agentboard/config.json with macOS Keychain storage. Add KeychainService, migrate existing tokens, strip token from config JSON on save.
close_reason: Closed

title: Collapsible sidebar and board for compact chat-only mode
description:
Allow the entire sidebar (projects/sessions/views) and the beads board panel to collapse so only the canvas/chat area is showing. Enables a compact mode for non-coding sessions where the full board isn't needed. The app shouldn't have to take the whole screen.

Possible approaches:
- Toggle button or keyboard shortcut to hide sidebar + board
- Remember collapsed state between launches
- Smooth animation for collapse/expand
- Consider a 'Focus Mode' that shows only chat + canvas
close_reason: Collapsible layout with Focus Mode implemented

title: Multi-subscriber event broadcast pattern
description:
Fix GatewayClient to support multiple concurrent event subscribers using broadcast pattern.

Current broken code (GatewayClient.swift ~line 217):


Fix: Implement multi-subscriber pattern like OpenClaw's GatewayConnection:

1. Store subscribers in dictionary: 
2. Broadcast to ALL subscribers in handleEvent()
3. Each call to events() returns new stream but adds to subscribers, doesn't replace
4. Clean up on stream termination

This ensures ChatView, heartbeat monitors, and any other consumers all receive events.

Depends on: AB-2vp
close_reason: Closed

title: Settings polish for remote connections
description: Add remote connection guidance in Settings: tips for SSH tunneling, Tailscale, LAN IP. Improve manual config UX with URL validation and protocol hints.
close_reason: Closed

title: Chat view stops updating / WebSocket events not refreshing UI
description:
Chat window in AgentBoard stops showing new messages after some time. WebSocket connection may still be alive but incoming chat events aren't triggering UI updates. Could be:
- Event stream continuation not being consumed after reconnect
- SwiftUI view not observing the messages array properly
- Event loop task getting cancelled
Need to verify the chat event handling in AppState's event consumption loop and ensure messages array mutations trigger view updates.
close_reason: Fix already applied in previous session: eventGeneration counter for stale stream detection, event stream finish on reconnect/disconnect, consumeGatewayEvents inlined into reconnect loop

title: Kaban Board should have manual refresh button
close_reason: Implemented: Added Refresh button to BoardView.swift toolbar, calls appState.refreshBeads()

comments.author: Blake Crane
comments.text:
Completed UI tests for Create Bead outcome validation. Changes made:

1. Added accessibilityIdentifier("BeadCard") and accessibilityLabel to TaskCardView.swift so UI tests can identify beads

2. Enhanced BeadOutcomeTests.swift with comprehensive outcome validation tests:
   - testCreateBead_IncreasesBoardCount: Verifies bead count increases after creation
   - testCreateBead_AppearsInOpenColumn: Verifies created bead is visible on board
   - testCreateBead_DisplaysCorrectTitle: Verifies correct title is displayed
   - testCreateBead_WithDescription_AppearsOnBoard: Verifies beads with descriptions work
   - testCreateBead_MultipleBeads_AllAppear: Verifies multiple beads can be created
   - testCreateBead_PersistsAfterSheetDismissal: Verifies persistence after navigation
   - testCreateBead_EmptyTitle_PreventsCreation: Verifies validation prevents empty titles
   - testCreateBead_Cancel_DoesNotCreate: Verifies cancel doesn't create beads

3. Updated UIStateQueryHelpers.swift beadIsVisible to use NSPredicate for more flexible matching

title: Outcome validation: New Session actually creates tmux session
description:
Write UI tests that validate New Session actually creates a tmux session:

Tests to add:
- testLaunchSessionCreatesTmuxSession: Verify session appears in SessionMonitor after Launch
- testLaunchSessionAppearsInSidebar: Verify session appears in Sessions list
- testLaunchSessionWithPromptInjectsPrompt: Verify prompt text is sent to tmux session
- testLaunchSessionFailureShowsError: Verify error UI when session launch fails

Use SessionMonitor.listSessions() to verify actual session creation. May need to mock TerminalLauncher to avoid opening real Terminal windows during tests.

Replaces/supplements AB-wj0 which only tests sheet presentation.

title: Session management feature completion
description:
Session managment feature is not yet complete. 

Final featutre should :
Exisiting sessions:
1. Have a list of open coding session with a status indicatiior under the views sectoin of the left panel.  
2. use can select a session and it will expand to become a visible interactive view of the tmux session.  IT would be nice if this could be integratedinto the app where it appears in the kabanboard area until dismissed but brining up the normal tmux window over agent board is acceptable.  

New Session: 
This is mostly implemented. 
1. User selects new session, selets Clause, Codex, or Opencode, enters optional info, session appears with optional comand injected. 
2. Sessoin can be tied to anepic or task. 
3. Session appears in the sessions list on AgenBoard.

description:

1. User selects new session, selets Clause, Codex, or Opencode, enters optional info, session appears with optional comand injected. 
2. Sessoin can be tied to anepic or task. 
3. Session appears in the sessions list on AgenBoard.

title: KeychainService round-trip tests
description: Unit tests for KeychainService: (1) saveToken then loadToken returns same string, (2) saveToken twice -> loadToken returns newer value, (3) deleteToken then loadToken returns nil, (4) loadToken with no prior save returns nil, (5) KeychainError.errorDescription returns non-empty string. IMPORTANT: call KeychainService.deleteToken() in teardown/defer to clean up real Keychain entries. File: AgentBoardTests/KeychainServiceTests.swift. Use Swift Testing.
close_reason: Closed

title: Fix session launch: tmux in iTerm2 with terminal fallback
description:
Session launch currently creates tmux sessions via a custom socket but never opens them visibly for the user. Fix the launch flow:

1. PRIMARY: Launch tmux session in iTerm2 (AppleScript to open new tab/window with tmux attach)
2. FALLBACK: If iTerm2 not installed, use Terminal.app with tmux attach
3. FALLBACK: If tmux not installed, launch agent CLI directly in iTerm2/Terminal.app

Detection order: check for iTerm2 first (NSWorkspace/LSCopyApplicationURLsForBundleIdentifier), then Terminal.app. Check for tmux via which/command -v.

Current issues:
- SessionMonitor.launchSession() creates the tmux session headlessly but never opens a terminal window
- User sees 'Launched session X' but nothing visible happens
- The tmux socket path /tmp/openclaw-tmux-sockets/openclaw.sock may not exist

Changes needed:
- SessionMonitor: Add method to open session in terminal (iTerm2 preferred, Terminal.app fallback)
- AppState.launchSession(): After creating tmux session, also open it visibly
- Add TerminalLauncher utility: detects available terminals, opens tmux attach or direct CLI
- Handle case where tmux socket dir doesn't exist (create it)
- openBeadInTerminal should also use iTerm2 when available (currently hardcoded to Terminal.app)
close_reason: Closed

title: Chat area should be expandable by dragging
description: Make the chat area resizable by dragging. Currently the chat panel has a fixed width. Add a drag handle/splitter between the main content area and the chat panel so users can resize it. This should work similar to the board view columns - draggable divider that updates the panel width.
close_reason: Added draggable divider between center panel and right panel. Users can now resize the chat panel width between 280px and 600px by dragging the divider

Fix: add proper padding, set minimum frame height, ensure all elements visible.

title: Graceful reconnection with event resume
description:
Add reconnection logic that gracefully resumes event consumption when WebSocket disconnects.

Current issue:
- When connection drops, event stream finishes
- No automatic reconnection logic
- User has to manually switch sessions or restart to re-establish

Implementation:
1. Detect WebSocket disconnect in handleDisconnect()
2. Trigger automatic reconnect with exponential backoff (1s, 2s, 4s, max 30s)
3. On reconnect, immediately request chat history to catch missed messages
4. Update AppState.chatConnectionState to reflect reconnection attempts
5. Show reconnection indicator in UI

Add to GatewayClient:
- reconnect() method
- isReconnecting flag
- reconnectTask for backoff management

Depends on: AB-2vp
close_reason: Implemented graceful reconnection: handleDisconnect() no longer finishes event subscribers, isReconnecting flag tracks transient disconnect state, connect() preserves subscribers on reconnect

title: Remove redundant Project/Agent labels above controls in New Session dialog
description: The New Session dialog shows extra 'Project' and 'Agent' labels above the form controls, but the same words are repeated right below on the controls themselves. Remove the redundant labels for a cleaner UI.

title: Outcome validation: Settings save actually persists
description:
Write UI tests that validate Settings Save actually persists:

Tests to add:
- testSaveSettingsPersistsGatewayURL: Set URL, save, query AppConfigStore, verify persisted
- testSaveSettingsPersistsToken: Set token, save, query AppConfigStore, verify persisted
- testSettingsLoadOnAppLaunch: Set values, terminate app, relaunch, verify values loaded
- testManualModeTogglePersists: Switch to Manual, save, relaunch, verify still Manual

Use AppConfigStore directly to verify persistence. Test actual user flow end-to-end.

title: Fix launch session error
description: Launch Session is giving an error (see screenshot from 2026-02-21). Need to investigate and fix the session launch flow. Error appears when clicking Launch in the New Session sheet. Check: 1) tmux socket path, 2) session monitor integration, 3) error handling/display.

title: Improve collapse/expand animation and add toggle button
description:
Current collapse behavior is wrong — the chat area resizes during transitions. Correct behavior:
1. COLLAPSE: Chat stays same size, sidebar and board slide LEFT out of view (chat doesn't move or resize)
2. EXPAND: Sidebar and board slide back in FROM the left, pushing chat area right (chat stays same size)
3. Add a visible expand/retract toggle button above the 'Agent' label at the top-left of the chat panel
4. The toggle should be an arrow or chevron icon indicating direction
5. Animation should be smooth sliding, not crossfade
6. Chat panel width should remain constant throughout the transition
close_reason: Collapse/expand animations added with easeInOut transitions

title: Add project button in main UI

File: AgentBoardTests/AppStateMiscTests.swift. Use @MainActor struct + Swift Testing (@Suite, @Test, #expect). AppState is @Observable @MainActor so tests must be @MainActor.
